messages.original:
A large-scale Russian Geran-2 drone attack was carried out on the Chornomorsk Port in Odea Oblast, last night. Approximately 21 impacts were recorded, with very few interceptions. 
A large fire is now burning at the impact sites.

A large-scale Russian Geran-2 drone attack was carried out on the Chornomorsk Port in Odea Oblast, last night. Approximately 21 impacts were recorded, with very few interceptions. 
A large fire is now burning at the impact sites.

Last night, Russian Geran-2 drones attacked Sumy Oblast. Multiple drones impacted the Kachaniv gas processing plant (50.29712, 34.57017), while ~5 other drones struck targets in Sumy City.
Media 1 from Sumy City.
Media 2 & 3 from Kachaniv.

Last night, Russian Geran-2 drones attacked Sumy Oblast. Multiple drones impacted the Kachaniv gas processing plant (50.29712, 34.57017), while ~5 other drones struck targets in Sumy City.
Media 1 from Sumy City.
Media 2 & 3 from Kachaniv.
Several Russian Geran-2 drones attacked Slovyansk, Donetsk Oblast, last night. The main target seems to be the High-Voltage Insulator Plant, where a fire was seen burning afterwards.
Several Russian Geran-2 drones attacked Slovyansk, Donetsk Oblast, last night. The main target seems to be the High-Voltage Insulator Plant, where a fire was seen burning afterwards.

In Zaporizhzhia Oblast, intensified MLRS and artillery shelling of areas south of Zaporizhzhia City continues. The rates of Russian artillery shelling are especially high, targeting positions several kilometres behind the frontline.

Ukrainian UAVs attacked the Kotovsky Gas Processing Plant, near the village of Kotovo, Volgograd Oblast. The number of impacts is currently unknown, but a fire can be seen burning afterwards, which is also visible through NASA FIRMS. 
Coordinates: 50.344909, 44.710195

Ukrainian UAVs attacked the Kotovsky Gas Processing Plant, near the village of Kotovo, Volgograd Oblast. The number of impacts is currently unknown, but a fire can be seen burning afterwards, which is also visible through NASA FIRMS. 
Coordinates: 50.344909, 44.710195

One of the targets hit by KAB glide-bombs in Zaporizhzhia City was the Omelchenko Machine-building plant.  This plant is/was used to produce airplane and helicopter engines, and other critical aviation parts for civilian and military use. It also produces‚Ä¶

Sentinel satellite imagery reveals the damage to the Omelchenko Machine-building plant (part of the Motor Sich company) after it was struck by multiple KAB glide-bombs on October 6. 
Workshop No. 610 at Omelchenko Plant, as well as aircraft engine testing stands for the neighbouring "Progress" plant, sustained heavy damage. 
Image credit

Russian forces have captured the village of Filiya, Novopavlivka direction, Dnipropetrovsk Oblast.
Pre-war population: ~133.
Total land area: ~0.35 km¬≤.

With only 13 minutes left until the ceasefire comes into effect, Israeli attacks have continued across the Gaza Strip at a higher-than-usual intensity.
At least 14 airstrikes, 12 artillery shellings, 7 robot detonations, and 10 instances of gunfire, helicopter fire, and vehicle fire have been recorded over the past 9 hours. 
Most attacks have been concentrated in Gaza City, with some taking place near the Netzarim Corrdior, and in Khan Younis.

With only 13 minutes left until the ceasefire comes into effect, Israeli attacks have continued across the Gaza Strip at a higher-than-usual intensity.
At least 14 airstrikes, 12 artillery shellings, 7 robot detonations, and 10 instances of gunfire, helicopter fire, and vehicle fire have been recorded over the past 9 hours. 
Most attacks have been concentrated in Gaza City, with some taking place near the Netzarim Corrdior, and in Khan Younis.

Two Russian KAB glide-bombs struck Slovyansk, Donetsk Oblast, just under an hour ago. One impacted the Betonmash machine-building factory (48.83417, 37.58467), and another hit an unknown "critical infrastructure facility".

Two Russian KAB glide-bombs struck Slovyansk, Donetsk Oblast, just under an hour ago. One impacted the Betonmash machine-building factory (48.83417, 37.58467), and another hit an unknown "critical infrastructure facility".
A ceasefire in the Gaza Strip has officially come into effect. As of now, no Israeli offensive activity is observed.

Ukrainians Seeking To Influence Polish Politics
Polish politicians want to limit the ability of Ukrainian immigrants to influence the country's politics. The large number of foreigners on Polish soil and the constant pressure from Ukrainian groups to change the course of Polish politics are raising concerns among officials and parliamentarians, creating an atmosphere of internal tension that could lead to serious problems in the near future.
Recently, Polish MP Slawomir Mentzen said that it is necessary to prevent Ukrainian immigrants from gaining influence in national politics. According to him, Ukrainians have behaved inappropriately, as if they were in a position to tell Poles what to do in their own country. Mentzen sees this as a serious problem and calls on the country to pay attention to the issue and ensure that foreign interests do not gain relevance in local politics.
üëâ

Russian Army Intensifies Strikes On Kupyansk As Troops Enter City Center
The Russian military has begun to advance in the center of Kupyansk in the Kharkiv direction, according to reports from October 9, amid intense strikes targeted Ukrainian positions inside the city and supply routes nearby.
The Zapad [West] Group of Forces has reportedly taken over the bus station in the heart of Kupyansk, mounting more pressure on Kiev forces who are currently cornered in a narrow strip in the center of the key city, mainly along the Privokzalnaya street connected to the southern entrance.
Ukrainian troops in Kupyansk continue to show resistance. However, this mainly due to the deployment of blocking detachments by Kiev forces.
üëâ

Military Situation In Gaza Strip On October 9, 2025 (Map Update)

New Russian Offensive Is Developing In Dnepropetrovsk Close To Pokrovsk (Videos)
The Russian military appears to be developing an offensive to the west of the city of Pokrovsk in Donetsk, into Dnepropetrovsk with Novopavlivka as the main target.
In recent days, the Tsentr [Center] Group of Forces resumed advance to the west of Pokrovsk, capturing Udachne, then entering the Western Mine Number 1 to the north of settlement. By October 9, Russian troops had reportedly begun a push from the area to the west of Udachne towards Dnepropetrovsk.
Gains were reported close to Molodetske, which is located just a few kilometers to the northeast of Novopavlivka. Russian troops are now reportedly battling Kiev forces in the outskirts of the settlement.
üëâ

Ukrainian At Center Of Suspected Israeli Plot To Carry Out Bombings In Lebanon
Lebanon‚Äôs General Security thwarted an Israeli plot to carry out simultaneous bombings at commemorative events in the shrine of Hezbollah‚Äôs late Secretary-General Hassan Nasrallah and in the Sports City in Beirut, Lebanese media reported on October 9.
According to the reports published by Al Modon, Bint Jbeil and other Lebanese news websites, the plot was orchestrated by a foreign individual named ‚ÄúMartin,‚Äù residing in Germany.
Investigations revealed that he was the primary operator, communicating with network members through encrypted applications, with the members unaware of each other‚Äôs identities. The General Security was reportedly able to confirm his ties to Israeli intelligence.

Russian Strikes Paralyze Ukraine's Gas Production, Kyiv Appeals To West Ahead Of Winter
The parties to the conflict continued their active exchange of strikes on October 8-9, focusing their efforts on critical infrastructure and military-logistical facilities. On the night of October 9, port facilities in Odesa and Chornomorsk were attacked by Russian Geran kamikaze drones and Kalibr cruise missiles, causing large-scale fires and a powerful secondary detonation. Furthermore, Dnipropetrovsk Region encountered, for the first time, the use of a hybrid munition‚Äîa missile with a glide aviation bomb.
Massive Russian strikes on energy infrastructure facilities in Kharkiv and Poltava regions led to the destruction of key gas production hubs. According to expert estimates, about 60% of Ukraine's gas production capacity has been disabled, effectively paralyzing domestic fuel production. Industrial compressor stations, gas gathering and storage systems...
